poem:
**An Empire at Play**

Brick by brick  
the mind builds—  
not castles, but  
histories  
amassed in the  
quiet hours,  
fathers' hands drafting  
the past,  
pixel by pixel,  
each move, a  
commentary  
on time's expansive  
canvas,  
while the sons,  
flit and float,  
unanchored.  
An empire  
etched in digital  
dust.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Age of Empires at 25: the strategy game that inspired a generation of historians My dad is the kind of man who will find a game he enjoys and stick to it. While I have always flitted about, hopping between different genres, he remains the only person I know who does absolutely everything it has to offer. When people ask, “who actually finishes these enormous games?”, I can respond with confidence that it is a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
